intro: Artia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited artia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and oval-shaped, leathery leaves. Artia brachycarpa typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
